content.description: Sit start on a flake and move up to a side pull, then to a flat jug.  From the jug work slightly left on small edges and top out.
content.location: On the downhill side of the boulder problem start at the approximate middle of the face.

content.description: Sit start on a good diagonal hold and move up to a crimp before moving straight up to better holds.  Top out using sloping holds, high feet, and pressing out a mantle, this is the crux of the boulder.
content.location: Furthest uphill boulder in the Main Area, this boulder is perched on a lower boulder and has a large overhang on the right side.  Problem starts on the left side of the boulder.

content.description: Squat start in the cave on good edges, climb out and left.
content.location: Furthest left route in the cave.

content.description: High start on a jug rail, get high feet and mantle.
content.location: Right of Yvly

content.description: Sit start with an incut jug for the left hand and the right and on the good portion of the right edge of the boulder.  Move up to the good holds at the lip of the boulder and top out easily.
content.location: Above the Yvly boulder and below the Brest Flop boulder.  Visible from the trail.

content.description: Two routes to the right from Yvly. Sit start, hand on a low flake, to a moderate edge, then work the crack. Topping out might be the crux.
Jump to a good flake at the corner of the boulder, move up and grab a jug before traversing left to easier ground.
content.location: Right of Scratch

content.description: A good warmup route to the area. Right facing jugs to large left hold up top with interesting feet.
content.location: On front of the shoe block

content.description: Start on bad holds and campus to a good hold at the lip (Dave's variation), top out following the groove.  An easier variation (V0) involves a jump start to the good hold at the lip.
content.location: Left side of the Yvly  boulder

content.description: Stand start on a good low left hand edge and a bad right hand crimp.  Bump the left hand to another small edge, then throw to a sloping edge.  Reset the feet and throw left again to a good incut flake.  Easier moves on bigger holds to topout.
content.location: The round boulder closest to the hill.  The problem starts on the downhill side of the boulder on the holds around face height.

content.description: Sit start in a pit on a good, but flexing edge.  Make big moves between good edges move right to grab a jug and top out.
content.location: Largest boulder in the Lower Main Area.

content.description: Sit start the same as "Your Mind" but upon reaching the larger holds, move left on good holds and top out easily.
content.location: Furthest uphill boulder in the Main Area, this boulder is perched on a lower boulder and has a large overhang on the right side.  Problem starts on the left side of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start on the low jug on the right side of the overhanging face and move left using the low holds, finish on the jugs below grunt dihedral.  This problem has some long reaches and requires some flexibility.
content.location: Starts on the right side of the cave boulder.

content.description: Sit start below grunt dihedral, and move right using the low holds, finish on the low jug on the right side of the overhanging face.  This problem has some long reaches and requires some flexibility.
content.location: Starts in the middle of the cave boulder.

content.description: Sit start with a flat side pull and a right hand jug, make big moves to small edges before a deadpoint move to a jug.  Continue on big holds for a few moves, until all holds disappear, trust the mantle to top out this great problem.
content.location: Right side of the Cave boulder.

content.description: Stand start on high, very sharp crimps and move up to a large sloping edge and finish up on Leafy.
content.location: Slightly right of Leafy, one of the starting crimps is one of the higher feet on Leafy.

content.description: Climb the face towards the top of the boulder stacked above.
content.location: Route right of ‘Breast Flop’ V4.

content.description: The dihedral right of ‘’Urine Escape Hatch’ 6ft to over. SS
Right face of the fire dihedral on the boot block connecting to the arete. Sit start.
Start on the same holds as Twitch, move straight up and get high feet and mantle.
content.location: Right of Twitch

content.description: An extension to the obvious route of ‘Shoe Lace’ on the the west face of the boot-looking block starting at the arete.

Route starts right of the cave area and traverses left to a juggy rail. Step up to a good edge and top out. An exit from the rail moving left feels natural and is a tick easier alternative finish.The details of the line are a bit limited but assume the left block supporting the main boulder is off.
content.protection: Good landing; crash pad and a spot
content.location: Cave next to the shoe shaped boulder across from the spray painted wall.

content.description: Start on the lowest point of the boot boulder, using the Def start holds.  Traverse right and into the crux, then continue traversing until the start holds are reached again.
content.location: Middle boulder shaped like a boot.

content.description: Squat start using the good sidepull and feet, move up the slab.
content.location: The slab around the right corner of the Leafy Boulder, start slightly left of the large tree.

content.description: Sit start on the Yvly starting flake, and once you reach the jug, throw to the next flat jug about 4 feet to the right and control the swing.  Top out either straight up on small edges,  or move slightly right to the crack.
content.location: Same start as Yvly.

content.description: The main cluster of about five or six boulders, some of which reaching as high as about 15 feet.
